purpose: Walking Skeleton implementation for architecture validation
description: Walking Skeleton implementation for architecture validation based on Alistair Cockburn's methodology. Creates minimal end-to-end implementations to validate architecture and reduce risk early in projects through systematic risk reduction and architectural validation.

system-description.description: Description of the system for walking skeleton implementation

--minimal.details: Implements smallest possible end-to-end functionality for architecture validation

--risk-reduction.details: Identifies and mitigates highest architectural risks through implementation

--validation.details: Validates architectural decisions through working implementation

--iterative.details: Develops skeleton incrementally with stakeholder feedback

examples.description: Minimal payment processing skeleton with architecture validation
examples.context: When validating payment system architecture early in development

examples.description: Authentication skeleton focused on risk reduction
examples.context: When reducing architectural risks in authentication systems
